intro: Osmorhiza nuda, commonly known as the naked boneset, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and carrots. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive, hollow structure that gives it its common name. Osmorhiza nuda is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
